title: What software does Riot use to make splasharts?
body: If anyone knows, i'd be really greatful if you told me {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

replies.body: We have artists working on campus, riot artists working remotely, and freelancers.   I have yet to see one not using Adobe.  (Mostly Photoshop) .    Some artists use other stuff for early sketches (esp if working on an ipad)--  but most use Photoshop.
How does one become a full-time artist for Riot? And what's the average salary?

That's a job that I actually wanted to get myself into, I have the creativity side of all this but the problem is i'm quite still far away from being qualified to be a professional concept artist at Riot Games, as I am still a student in college who is trying to gain/improve his skills on digital drawing.
If you go to Riot Games careers you can see what positions are open and what they are looking for
Microsoft Paint, bro. They also use MS Paint with mouse for maximum art.

Riot commissions artists to create their splasharts (or they have artists specifically working for them on the art team.) I have seen both methods over my years ofplaying.

Each artist uses different software, but the most common is probably Photoshop, Paint Tool Sai or Manga (Clip) Studio. 

If you want to emulate the artist techniques, I suggest watching videos and tutorials for each program to decide. Personally, I love Manga Studio (currently 32$ on Amazon for me).
Pretty sure photoshop is the industry standard with some odd ones out there like corel painter and paint tool sai
